description:
A couple of style mods in proxy_config_service_linux.cc

Relates to argument passing and iterating over an STL container.

r=eroman



Committed: http://src.chromium.org/viewvc/chrome?view=rev&revision=49478

messages.text:
http://codereview.chromium.org/2735012/diff/1/2
File net/proxy/proxy_config_service_linux.cc (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/2735012/diff/1/2#newcode571
net/proxy/proxy_config_service_linux.cc:571: void AddProxy(const std::string prefix&, const std::string& value) {
typo here:

const std::string& prefix

http://codereview.chromium.org/2735012/diff/1/2#newcode1003
net/proxy/proxy_config_service_linux.cc:1003: config->proxy_rules().bypass_rules.Clear();
I suggest keeping the Clear() outside of the if (so we make sure it is empty when unused).

http://codereview.chromium.org/2735012/diff/1/2#newcode1005
net/proxy/proxy_config_service_linux.cc:1005: std::vector<std::string>::const_iterator it(ignore_hosts_list.begin());
I actually prefer the use of integer indexes for vectors, since it is simpler. but either is fine.

http://codereview.chromium.org/2735012/diff/1/2#newcode1007
net/proxy/proxy_config_service_linux.cc:1007: config->proxy_rules().bypass_rules.AddRuleFromString(*its);
*it

Hi eroman,

Please let me know what you think.

-- Ziad

subject: A couple of style mods in proxy_config_service_linux.cc...
